block.p: Nicole Elizabeth Eldridge, a daughter of Joyce and W. Lawrence Eldridge of West Newton, Mass., was married last evening to Jeffrey David Marcus, the son of Gerri and Averill Marcus of Miami. Rabbi Frank Waldorf officiated at the Gamble Mansion, a historic house in Boston.

Mr. and Mrs. Marcus, both 27, graduated magna cum laude from Yale University, where the bride was the artistic director of YaleDancers, a student troupe. The bridegroom, who was president of the Yale Debating Association, also received a J.D. degree from Yale Law School. The bride received a master's degree in clinical psychology in May from the University of Miami, where she is a doctoral candidate in the field.

Nicole Elizabeth Eldridge, a daughter of Joyce and W. Lawrence Eldridge of West Newton, Mass., was married last evening to Jeffrey David Marcus, the son of Gerri and Averill Marcus of Miami. Rabbi Frank Waldorf officiated at the Gamble Mansion, a historic house in Boston.

Mr. and Mrs. Marcus, both 27, graduated magna cum laude from Yale University, where the bride was the artistic director of YaleDancers, a student troupe. The bridegroom, who was president of the Yale Debating Association, also received a J.D. degree from Yale Law School. The bride received a master's degree in clinical psychology in May from the University of Miami, where she is a doctoral candidate in the field.

The bride's father retired as the sports editor of The Christian Science Monitor. Her mother is the director of communications and public information at the Buckingham Browne & Nichols School in Cambridge, Mass.

The bridegroom was until June a clerk for Judge Stanley Marcus of the United States Court of Appeals for the 11th Circuit in Miami. Later this month, he is to begin as a clerk for Judge Donald Middlebrooks of the Federal District Court there. His mother is a speech-language pathologist in Miami, where his father practices labor and employment law.
